name: ITP - Unbound Flexible Pavement Construction
template name: ITP - Unbound Flexible Pavement Construction Rev0

name: FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure that all employees and subcontractors are:
– using the correct and complete set of drawings
– all drawings are the latest revision
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Drawings and drawing registers
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
○ All crushed rock proposed for use shall be current registered mixes in accordance with VicRoads RC500.02 and conform to specified requirements applicable to that class of product
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
1.3 Implementation of all measures and controls
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: PSP, EMP, TMP, SWMS & WP`
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: PSP, EMP, TMP, JSEA, SWMS, WP
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Plant and equipment used in the Works are appropriate to achieve specification requirements and is inducted
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
2.1 The commencement of construction of base and subbase
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Underlying ITP signed off

○ Identifying and removing soft areas to a minimum of 200mm depth. Underlying layer shall be clean of all foreign matter. The edges of previously placed materials shall be watered. Proof roll underlying layer prior to commencing
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Where material is scheduled for measurement by loose volume in delivery vehicles or by mass, a delivery docket for each load shall be issued to the Superintendent at the point of delivery.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Material is to be compacted to the overall thickness shown in the drawings (dependent on pavement type), subbase not less than the specified thickness by more than 15 mm
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Width of each side of the pavement shall not be less than the specified offset width or more than 50 mm outside the specified offset width when measured at right angles from the centre line or design line.
○ Where pavement is to be constructed to the lip level of kerb and channel, it shall be constructed flush with the lip of the channel or not more than 5 mm above.
○ Any material that has been compacted and then trimmed from the compacted surface to conform
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (a) material shall be spread in such a manner as to minimise the number of joints
(b) transverse joints shall be offset from one layer to the next by not less than 2m
(c) longitudinal joints shall be offset from one layer to the next by not less than 150mm.
(e) longitudinal joints shall be located within 300 mm of the planned position of traffic lanes lines or within 300 mm of the centre of a traffic lane.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
3.1 Determine Testing Scale & Initial testing frequency

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Where testing is specified in Clause 304.10(c) or (d) and Clause 304.12 requires it to be Scale B, the first lot of each pavement course shall be tested for post-compaction grading and PI.

○ If the first lot each pavement course satisfies the specified post compaction requirements in Clause 304.10(a) and (b), as applicable, no further post-compaction testing will be required for that pavement course.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Table 204.161 304.10 (c or d) 304.10 (a) 304.10 (b)(ii) Table 304.101 Table 304.103 304.11 (c) (ii)
INSPECTION/TEST METHOD: Document Review/ Site Inspection
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: If the first lot does not meet the requirements specified in Clause 304.10(a) and (b), the Contractor shall then seek approval from the Superintendent before work proceeds.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP sIgned
○ All pavement layers shall be compacted to withstand rolling and shall be test rolled in accordance with Section 173, prior to acceptance of the layer.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
FREQUENCY: Every Lot, Every second lot (reduced frequency)

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The calculation of density ratio shall be based on tests performed using Modified compactive effort. The work shall be assessed for compliance with Scale B requirements for testing and acceptance of compaction as specified in the table below
Lower Subbase Layers || Upper Subbase Layers || Base Layers: Layer directly beneath the Bituminous Surfacing || Base Layers: Other Layers
Not less than 98.0 || Not less than 98.0 || Not less than 100.0 || Not less than 99.0
Not less than 97.0 || Not less than 97.0 || Not less than 98.0 || Not less than 98.0
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
FREQUENCY: Refer to table 304.111 for various minimum frequency or testing for Grading and PL

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: If specified in Clause 304.10(c) or Clause 304.10(d), following completion of compaction, material shall be tested for post-compaction grading or Plasticity Index (PI) at the frequency specified in Clause 304.11 for the appropriate Scale of Testing specified in Clause 304.12(a).
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Layer to be finished to a smooth and uniform surface and after compaction shall have no point deviation > 8mm from 3m straight edge. The subbase shall also not be less than the specified thickness by more than 15mm
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: 304.06(b, d, i) Drawings Table 304.062
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Each level measurement shall be taken at random  locations over the area of the lot in accordance with the VicRoads Test Method and the number of measurements taken within each lot shall not be less than the number specified in Table 304.061.
○ The mean and standard deviation of the departures from the design surface level for the pavement courses at their respective levels within each lot shall meet the requirements of Table 304.062.
Table 304.062 Surface Level Tolerances for the Pavement Courses
Scale of Level Measurement: Scale A
Lower Subbase: x̅ Range (mm) || Max. S (mm)
Upper Subbase: x̅ Range (mm) || Max. S (mm)
Scale of Level Measurement: Scale B
Lower Subbase: x̅ Range (mm) || Max. S (mm)
Upper Subbase: x̅ Range (mm) || Max. S (mm)
1. x̅ is the mean value of all level readings taken in the lot
2. S is the standard deviation of all level readings taken in the lot
3. A negative value designates a measured departure below the design level and positive value designates a surface level above the design level
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
